author: Jesús García
comment: Horrible date picker, please change.  Works well with CooSpo chest strap and S8. Interface could do with improving. I like the alarm option but needs to be able to be more customisable as in several types of alarm at once and different/ custom sounds.  At this moment language can be either English or Russian.  Let me know if you'd like free help translating the app to Spanish. Keep it up.

OK just got a garmin hrm-tri. Imagine disappointment when ant+ USB stick didn't support the strap.    Thus app appears to work it connects and records but need it to tell strap to record a sessoo n and then download it.  Want to download so might have to splurge for download capabilities.  So far it's ok.  Will add more as needed

author: Adam Newman
comment: Tried several apps including Runtastic which used to work, but this was the only one that would connect to my Zephyr Hxm2 Smart HR monitor. The UI isn't Material, but if you want to see your heart rate zones and GPS history, this does that.

author: bartek z
comment: Tested with Polar H7 band. Works very well.   Application does what I expected it to do. There are no problems with prolonged usage, tomorrow I ma going to have app run measurement for an entire day.  Edit : picked it up again and I cannot find my Polar H7 monitor in connect section. Did something change in application? It worked like charm during spring 2017. My hrm is instantly detected by polar beat software.

author: Yusuf
comment: (1) Stops responding if I don't give location permission, likely to stuck in an infinite loop. (2). Doesn't work with my ANT+ heart rate monitor, while Stava app and Cyclemeter app do. Already gave permission to access location & body sensors but it just doesn't detect my heart rate monitor. | xiaomi redmi note 3, android 6

author: Martin Slater
comment: Not a good start. I've not even used it yet and ..  1. I had to press the back button 712 times to set my birth date, a truly appalling date picker, the worst I've ever seen, ever, anywhere, and I've been writing software since 1976. Unless you want to send me a birthday card why not just ask for my age?  2. I paid for the version that allows export of data and found that it still shows adverts, apparently there's another charge to remove the adverts.  3. You can uninstall it but you can't get a refund because "As your item was available for immediate delivery you agreed to waive your statutory withdrawal period. See the Google Play Refund Policy and the Terms of Service." That's a new one on me.  I'll review this later when I've tried it, I hope I can give it some stars.

author: Dennis Fay
comment: When it works, it's pretty good. But freezes often and does not consistently record. I have the full version and it was better before the update

author: Matthias De Geyter
comment: Works with my ANT+ belt. Would be cool if you could have an alarm every time you cross a zone limit (e.g. synthesised speech that tells you the new zone)

author: Witold Baryluk
comment: Cannot use. It asks repeatedly for permissions for device location, and when you deny it (and say to not ask again), it locks entire UI.

author: Marian Minar
comment: App working very good with Mio Link. For me is better origin software ftom Mio. New version is much better. Recomendation. Add sport pictures to records and connentary would be better.

author: Viacheslav Batishchev
comment: Good app to record HR activity. But... It is not possible to see historic recordings!! Without it the application is useless.

author: Christopher Bishop
comment: Pretty average but at least it works with my Garmin strap. Entering dob is fastidious when you were born in 1960🤔

author: Steve Ward
comment: Great heart rate app, connected to my garmin ant+ belt first time and has the function to leave the phone screen on for your workout... why don't all exercise apps do this! Love it!

author: J.P. JPGINVEST
comment: Not very intuitive.  Doesn't work with all devices. And too many intrusive ads. Removed

author: Alex Graham
comment: Sorry if the app doesn't work without my location then the app doesn't work at all.
Tried 2 times, crashed 2 times, result uninstalled.

author: Jude K
comment: Does not work with Garmin Ant+ chest strap (first version) , which is one of the most basic hrm out there

author: Rev Santos
comment: It works. Ads are not that annoying.

author: Joda Gordon
comment: Can't disable location tracking.

author: Stephen Wells
comment: Works very well on my Samsung s7 with CooSpo belt

author: Dave Reed
comment: Better than the app designed for my Polar H7.  Connects right away and easy to use.

author: Sascha Manitz
comment: Fair enough for a free version. Fast connection to ANT+ and stable operation.

author: Brian Schipper
comment: Worked with Polar H7.  Used it just to check my Fitbit HR accuracy.

author: John Lawson
comment: Smashing wee app

author: Ryan Nowakowski
comment: Date picker is atrocious
Works well and appears to be accurate.

author: Максим Сорока
comment: Работает с CooSpo Heart Rate Monitor

author: Tiberiu Toth
comment: Working fine with MIO Alpha 2

author: Serge Sergey
comment: nice one works as I Expected

author: 前悟記
comment: Rubbished

author: Faik Bagirov
comment: Great
Would not recognize Wahoo Blue HR device (New battery; detected by other apps) no matter what I did w/ the phone's or app's BT settings.  Also closed and restarted the app...nothing.

author: Frank Gadelha
comment: Great app. Works 100% with my Garmin HR Band.

author: John burke
comment: Installed it just frozen with huawie watch 3198.

author: Rudei Ovidiu
comment: Great app

author: Michael Pepper
comment: The only app which did what I wanted and did it correctly. Im using a Sony Xperia M5 and Ant+ Garmin HR strap. A couple features which would be ideal is to have a screen dedicated heart rate with a large font and possibly an option for different sound alerts and maybe vibration. I would give it 4 stars but after awhile it loses connection to my HR belt and I have to manually connect it again.
title: Best App but could be far better

author: perry ponzo
comment: This is an excellent app for those looking to log heart rate vs GPS & altitude while hiking in the mountains. Files are saved as CSV type and can easily be exported to Excel for graphing purposes. I love this app, its one of the few that will work with a GARMIN HR watch..and a SAMSUNG S4 (watch must be connected via ANT+).. Note: the app may not work on all phones ( ie: my LG G5). Note2: The phone must be connected to the internet if you plan on mapping (using the GPS function in the app),..not always easy if you're in the mountains Google ANT+ and cell phones prior to buying a cell phone if you plan on matching a heart rate device such as my Garmin watch. The app is very easy to connect to the watch and very easy to use.

author: David B.
comment: I got this because it continuously measures and displays the heart rate from the watch, as a standalone. Furthermore, display is with big red, easily seen digits. When connected to the phone it can record and show the HR in diagrams. Improvement points: I tried starting this with the watch on the table, which apparently also has a heartbeat, and it fluctuates (!). Sometimes start up on me, not the table, can take minutes to register. Finally, HR references, e g max pulse, in the diagram are non changeable.
title: Very clear continuous display of heart rate on the Huawei Watch

author: Francisco Gabilondo Jr.
comment: Used this app since December last year worked pretty well with my scosche hrm, and was happy with app overall. But... Last update changed something bc it just doesn't connect at all with the hrm, it even produces malfunction. I reset the device and no change. Issue comes from app. Hope y'all fix it bc it was a decent app! I'm sadly moving on.
title: Good app, last update crashed me.
